info-text: Ist ein Griess oft aus Hartweizen.
author: je
references:
1. General info on wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semolina
2. General info on wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durum
calculation-process-documentation:
Granules of durum wheat. It is a semolina that is the coarse, purified wheat middlings of durum wheat used also in making pasta, breakfast cereals, puddings, and couscous. In the milling process whole grains include the bran (hard outer layer of grain) and germ, refined grains lack the bran and germ (white flour). In the mill the bran and germ are separated from the semolina or starch (endosperm). The semolina is then ground into flour. The endosperm is milled into different grades because the inner part of the endosperm tends to break down into smaller pieces than the outer part. Different grades of flour can be thus produced -> semolina (1).

The milling process for durum wheat seems to be a bit more effort than that of wheat (2)
name: Couscous
comments: Unterschiede mit Weizenproduktion bezüglich Ernte oder Inputs sind nicht berücksichtigt. Auch ist das Mahlprozess anscheinend aufwändiger als bei  Weizen
